answers.answer: Hi,Your question would be best answers by the doctor/s providing the treatment. I am assuming that she would have stage 3 disease. The 5 year survival estimates would be less than 10% for such cases. These estimates however, would be affected by individual patient factors, which would include how much the cancer is already affecting her daily living, the presence of other problems like hypertension, diabetes, other lung diseases like emphysema. For patients undergoing chemoradiation, one of the problems encountered would be swelling of the lung so she may have some coughing fits and some shortness of breath. Take it a day at a time. Stay positive.

question: My mom is starting lung cancer tx Monday which includes chemo and radiation.  How can I prepare for what lies ahead of me as her sole caretaker?  What is her chance of being here for the next few years without spending each week doing chemo?
title: Mom is starting tx on Monday
